Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired red) below; exterior: from left, vertcial strips of large maeander squares and vertical dotted squares between pairs of lines; painted decoration consisting of goose (part of wing, tail, lower body and legs remaining) to right; corner pendant roundel and rosette as filling ornament; ancient repair hole at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7). According to Lemos, there is a rosette in added white outline on the interior surface of the sherd, but there are no traces remaining (Lemos 1991, 237).
An incised diagonal on the left of the interior could be the end of a graffito inscription.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43 note 96, p. 72, p. 237, no. 167, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0201) (phase 2)
